classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Accordion
classes.description: The Accordion class used to display a list of collapsible components All but the selected item are expected to be collapsed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Alert
classes.description: The Alert class is a component that displays a message and one or more buttons in a view that pops up over all other controls and views. The Alert component uses the AlertView bead to display a modal dialog with a title and a variety of buttons configured through the flag property of its show() static function. The Alert component uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: the bead used to create the parts of the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead used to handle input events. org.apache.royale.core.IBorderBead: if present, draws a border around the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBackgroundBead: if present, places a solid color background below the Alert.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.BinaryImage
classes.description: The Image class is a component that displays a bitmap. The Image uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Image, including the url/binary property. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the visual elements of the component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Button
classes.description: The Button class is a simple button.  Use TextButton for buttons that should show text.  This is the lightest weight button used for non-text buttons like the arrow buttons in a Scrollbar or NumericStepper.  The most common view for this button is CSSButtonView that allows you to specify a backgroundImage in CSS that defines the look of the button.  However, when used in ScrollBar and when composed in many other components, it is more common to assign a custom view to the button.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar
classes.description: The ButtonBar class is a component that displays a set of Buttons. The ButtonBar is actually a List with a default horizontal layout and an itemRenderer that produces Buttons. The ButtonBar uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the ButtonBar, including the dataProvider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: handles input events. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: sizes and positions the component parts. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: produces itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or class factory to use.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBase
classes.description: The ButtonBase class is the base class for Button.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.CSSCheckBox
classes.description: The CSSCheckBox class implements the common user interface control.  The CSSCheckBox includes its text label and is styleable using CSS. To style the checkbox control, a `checkClassName` should be specified which corresponds to a CSS class name.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.CheckBox
classes.description: The CheckBox class implements the common user interface control.  The CheckBox includes its text label.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.CloseButton
classes.description: The CloseButton class is Button that displays an X and is commonly used in a Panel's TitleBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ComboBox
classes.description: The ComboBox class is a component that displays an input field and pop-up List with selections. Selecting an item from the pop-up List places that item into the input field of the ComboBox. The ComboBox uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItem, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Container
classes.description: The Container class implements a basic container for other controls and containers.  The position and size of the children are determined by a layout while the size of a Container can either be determined by its children or by specifying an exact size in pixels or as a percentage of the parent element.  This Container does not have a built-in scroll bar or clipping of its content should the content exceed the Container's boundaries. To have scroll bars and clipping, add the ScrollingView bead.  While the container is relatively lightweight, it should generally not be used as the base class for other controls, even if those controls are composed of children.  That's because the fundamental API of Container is to support an arbitrary set of children, and most controls only support a specific set of children.  And that's one of the advantages of beads: that functionality used in a Container can also be used in a Control as long as that bead doesn't assume that its strand is a Container.  For example, even though you can use a Panel to create the equivalent of an Alert control, the Alert is a control and not a Container because the Alert does not support an arbitrary set of children.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ControlBar
classes.description: The ControlBar class is used within a Panel as a place to position additional controls. The ControlBar appears at the bottom of the org.apache.royale.html.Panel and is not part of the Panel's scrollable content area. The ControlBar is a Container and implements the org.apache.royale.core.IChrome interface, indicating that is outside of the Container's content area. The ControlBar uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the component. org.apache.royale.core.IMeasurementBead: helps determine the overlay size of the ControlBar for layout. org.apache.royale.core.IBorderBead: if present, displays a border around the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBackgroundBead: if present, displays a solid background below the ControlBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DataContainer
classes.description: The DataContainer class is a component that displays multiple data items. The DataContainer uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the list. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or factory used to display an item in the list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid
classes.description: The DataGrid class displays a collection of data using columns and rows. Each column represents a specific field in the data set; each row represents a specific datum. The DataGrid is a composite component built with a org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar for the column headers and a org.apache.royale.html.List for each column. The DataGrid's view bead (usually org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridView) constructs these parts while itemRenderer factories contruct the elements to display the data in each cell.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DataGridButtonBar
classes.description: The DataGridButtonBar class extends ButtonBar and provides a class for styling the header region of the DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DataGridButtonBarTextButton
classes.description: The DataGridButtonBarTextButton class extends TextButton so that the buttons used in the DataGrid header can be styled separately from normal TextButtons.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DateChooser
classes.description: The DateChooser class is a component that displays a calendar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DateField
classes.description: The DateField class provides an input field where a date can be entered and a pop-up calendar control for picking a date as an alternative to the text field.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DividedContainer
classes.description: The DividedContainer lays out its children (either horizontally or vertically, depending on which layout is used) separated by dividers. The dividers can be moved to grow and shrink the children.  This is the base class. See HDividedContainer and VDividedContainer for useful implementations.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.DropDownList
classes.description: The DropDownList class implements the basic equivalent of the <select> tag in HTML. The default implementation only lets the user see and choose from an array of strings. More complex controls would display icons as well as strings, or colors instead of strings or just about anything. The default behavior only lets the user choose one and only one item. More complex controls would allow mutiple selection by not dismissing the dropdown as soon as a selection is made.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Form
classes.description: The Form class is a simple form.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Group
classes.description: The Group class provides a light-weight container for visual elements. By default the Group does not have a layout, allowing its children to be sized and positioned using styles or CSS.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HContainer
classes.description: A Container that has a HorizontalLayout. This is effectively the same as the pattern

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HDividedContainer
classes.description: This sub-class of DividedContainer organizes its children into columns separated by movable dividers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HGroup
classes.description: This Group subclass uses HorizontalLayout as its default layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HRule
classes.description: The HRule class displays a horizontal line

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.HTMLText
classes.description: The HTMLText class implements the basic control for adding HTML formatted text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Image
classes.description: Load Images.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ImageAndTextButton
classes.description: The ImageTextButton class implements a basic button that displays and image and text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ImageButton
classes.description: The ImageButton class presents an image as a button.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Label
classes.description: The Label class implements the basic control for labeling other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.List
classes.description: The List class is a component that displays multiple data items. The List uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the dataProvider, selectedItem, and so forth. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the list. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input and output. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead responsible for the size and position of the itemRenderers. org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper: the bead responsible for creating the itemRenders. org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer: the class or factory used to display an item in the list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.MXMLBeadView
classes.description: The MXMLBeadView class extends ContainerView and adds support for databinding and specification of children in MXML.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Menu
classes.description: The Menu class builds pop-up menus that are presented as a list, displayed at a specific location. The dataProvider should be an Array of either Strings or Objects; if Objects, set the Menu's labelField to identify the property in the Object to use for the labels in the Menu.  Use createMenu to create a Menu and add an event listener to be triggered when a menu item is selected.  var menu:Menu = Menu.createMenu(dataProvider); menu.addEventListener("itemSelected", handleSelection);  Present the menu using the show function: menu.show(component, xoffset, yoffset);  Pass a component to use a reference when calculating the position of the menu. Set an offset from the component's upper-left corner. If an item is selected the event listener will be called.  Note: submenus are not supported.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.MultilineLabel
classes.description: The MultilineLabel class implements the basic control for displaying multiline labels.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.NumericStepper
classes.description: The NumericStepper class is a component that displays a numeric value and up/down controls (using a org.apache.royale.html.Spinner) to increase and decrease the value by specific amounts. The NumericStepper uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the component of type org.apache.royale.core.IRangeModel. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: constructs the parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: handles the input events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Panel
classes.description: The Panel class is a Container component capable of parenting other components. The Panel has a TitleBar.  If you want to a Panel with a ControlBar, use PanelWithControlBar which will instantiate, by default, an ControlBar. The Panel uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Panel that includes the title and whether or not to display the close button. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: creates the parts of the Panel. org.apache.royale.core.IBorderBead: if present, draws a border around the Panel. org.apache.royale.core.IBackgroundBead: if present, provides a colored background for the Panel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.PanelWithControlBar
classes.description: The Panel class is a Container component capable of parenting other components. The Panel has a TitleBar and an optional org.apache.royale.html.ControlBar. The Panel uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model for the Panel that includes the title and whether or not to display the close button. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView: creates the parts of the Panel. org.apache.royale.core.IBorderBead: if present, draws a border around the Panel. org.apache.royale.core.IBackgroundBead: if present, provides a colored background for the Panel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.PopUpList
classes.description: The PopUpList class is a List that can be popped up or floated over the view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.RadioButton
classes.description: The RadioButton class is a component that displays a selectable Button. RadioButtons are typically used in groups, identified by the groupName property. RadioButton use the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the groupName. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the RadioButton..

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.RangeStepper
classes.description: The RangeStepper control allows for the selection of a single value from multiple choices.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.SimpleAlert
classes.description: The SimpleAlert class is a component that displays a message and an OK button. The SimpleAlert converts directly to window.alert() for HTML. SimpleAlert uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the message. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the Alert. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead responsible for handling input events. org.apache.royale.core.IBorderBead: a bead, if present, that draws a border around the control. org.apache.royale.core.IBackgroundBead: a bead, if present, that creates a solid-color background.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.SimpleList
classes.description: The SimpleList class is a component that displays data in a vertical column. This component differs from org.apache.royale.html.List in that it displays only string values and maps to the <select> HTML element.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Slider
classes.description: The Slider class is a component that displays a range of values using a track and a thumb control. The Slider uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, typically an IRangeModel, that holds the Slider values. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the Slider. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: the bead that handles input. org.apache.royale.core.IThumbValue: the bead responsible for the display of the thumb control. org.apache.royale.core.ITrackView: the bead responsible for the display of the track.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Spacer
classes.description: The Spacer class takes up space in the UI layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Spinner
classes.description: The Spinner class is a component that displays a control for incrementing a value and a control for decrementing a value. The org.apache.royale.html.NumericStepper uses a Spinner as part of the component. Spinner uses the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: an IRangeModel to hold the properties. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the Spinner. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadController: a bead that handles the input events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.SubAppLoader
classes.description: The SubAppLoader class can load Flash or HTML content into a space within an application. Use SubAppLoader to identify where the application should appear, then use its loadApplication() function to load the application dynamically.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Table
classes.description: The Table class represents an HTML <table> element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TableCell
classes.description: The TableCell class defines a table data cell in the Table component. This element may have nearly any type of Royale component as children.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TableHeader
classes.description: The TableHeader class defines a table header cell in the Table component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TableRow
classes.description: The TableRow class defines a row of a Table. This will translate to a <tr> elemement

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TextArea
classes.description: The TextArea class implements the basic control for multi-line text input.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TextButton
classes.description: The TextButton class implements a basic button that displays text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TextInput
classes.description: The TextInput class implements the basic control for single-line text input.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TextNode
classes.description: The TextNode class represents an HTML Text node element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TitleBar
classes.description: The TitleBar class is a Container component that displays a title and an optional close button. The TitleBar uses the following bead types:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the title and showCloseButton values. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the component. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadLayout: the bead that handles size and position of the component parts (org.apache.royale.html.Label and org.apache.royale.html.Button). org.apache.royale.core.IMeasurementBead: a bead that helps determine the size of the org.apache.royale.html.TitleBar for layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ToggleTextButton
classes.description: The ToggleButton class is a TextButton that supports a selected property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.ToolTip
classes.description: The Label class implements the basic control for labeling other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.Tree
classes.description: The Tree component displays structured data. The Tree uses a HierarchicalData object as its data provider.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.TreeGrid
classes.description: A TreeGrid is a combination of a Tree and a DataGrid. The first column of the TreeGrid is a Tree; the remaining columns are Lists. Each column of the TreeGrid is defined by the TreeGridColumn, which names the data field within each datum to be displayed. The dataProvider should be a HierarchicalData object with "children" properties to build the tree.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.UIModule
classes.description: The UIModule class is the base class for modules of user interface controls in Royale.  It is usable as the root tag of MXML documents and UI controls and containers are added to it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.UIModuleLoader
classes.description: The UIModuleLoader class can load a UIModule.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.VContainer
classes.description: A Container that has a VerticalLayout. This is effectively the same as the pattern

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.VDividedContainer
classes.description: This sub-class of DividedContainer organizes its children into rows separated by movable dividers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.VGroup
classes.description: This Group subclass uses VerticalLayout as its default layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.VRule
classes.description: The VRule class displays a vertical line

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.WebBrowser
classes.description: The WebBrowser provides a space in which to display a web page within a Royale application. Use the url property to change the location of the web page being displayed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.CurrencyFormatter
classes.description: The CurrencyFormatter class formats a value in separated groups. The formatter listens to a property on a model and when the property changes, formats it and dispatches a formatChanged event.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.DateFormatDDMMYYYY
classes.description: The DateFormatDDMMYYYY class formats the display of a DateField using DD/MM/YYYY format.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.DateFormatMMDDYYYY
classes.description: The DateFormatMMDDYYYY class formats the display of a DateField using MM/DD/YYYY format.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.DateFormatYYYYMMDD
classes.description: The DateFormatYYYYMMDD class formats the display of a DateField using YYYY-MM-DD format.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.NumberFormatter
classes.description: The NumberFormatter class formats a value in separated groups. The formatter listens to a property on a model and when the property changes, formats it and dispatches a formatChanged event.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.NumericOnlyTextInputBead
classes.description: The NumericOnlyTextInputBead class is a specialty bead that can be used with any TextInput control. The bead prevents non-numeric entry into the text input area.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.PasswordInputBead
classes.description: The PasswordInput class is a specialty bead that can be used with any TextInput control. The bead secures the text input area by masking the input as it is typed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.PasswordInputRemovableBead
classes.description: The PasswordInput class is a specialty bead that can be used with any TextInput control. The bead secures the text input area by masking the input as it is typed. PasswordInputRemovableBead adds the ability to remove the functionality at runtime.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.SimpleDateFormatter
classes.description: The DateFormatter class formats the display of a DateField using a format.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.TextPromptBead
classes.description: The TextPromptBead class is a specialty bead that can be used with any TextInput control. The bead places a string into the input field when there is no value associated with the text property.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.accessories.ToolTipBead
classes.description: The ToolTipBead class is a specialty bead that can be used with any control. The bead floats a string over a control if the user hovers over the control with a mouse.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.AbsolutePositioningViewBeadBase
classes.description: Use AbsolutePositioningViewBeadBase as the base class for custom control view beads. This class sets the strand's position style to "relative" (HTML platform) if it is not already set to either "absolute" or "relative". Then use this class's setAbsolutePosition(child, x, y) function to place children. The function not only set's the child's left and top styles (HTML platform), it also sets the child's position to "absolute" (HTML platform).  On the Flash platform, this class will only set the child's x and y properties without any other side effects.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.AccessibilityAltBead
classes.description: The AccessibilityAltBead class is a bead that can be used with any Image control. The bead places add an alt text attribute on a image.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.AccordionItemRendererView
classes.description: This class creates and manages the contents of an AccordionItemRenderer

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.AccordionView
classes.description: The AccordionView sets up the components for the Accordion component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.AlertMeasurementBead
classes.description: The AlertMeasureBead class provides boundary measurements for an org.apache.royale.html.Alert component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.AlertView
classes.description: The AlertView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Alert component. The job of the view bead is to put together the parts of the Alert, such as the title bar, message, and various buttons, within the space of the Alert component strand.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.BackgroundImageBead
classes.description: The BackgroundImageBead is used to render an image as the background to any component that supports it, such as Container.  Note that this bead is for ActionScript only since CSS/HTML allows this just by specifying a background image in the style selector. To use this bead, place a ClassReference to it

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.BinaryImageLoader
classes.description: The ImageView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Image component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ButtonBarReorderBead
classes.description: The ButtonBarReorderBead bead can be added to a ButtonBar to re-order the buttons using drag-and-drop. This bead will add additional beads as necessary.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ButtonBarView
classes.description: The ButtonBarView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar component. A ButtonBar is a type of List and ButtonBarView extends the ListView bead, adding a border.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.CSSButtonView
classes.description: The CSSButtonView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.Button class. It allows the look of the button to be expressed in CSS via the background-image style.  This view does not display text.  Use CSSTextButtonView and TextButton instead.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.CSSImageAndTextButtonView
classes.description: The CSSTextButtonView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.TextButton class. It allows the look of the button to be expressed in CSS via the background-image style and displays a text label.  This view does not support right-to-left text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.CSSTextToggleButtonView
classes.description: The CSSTextToggleButtonView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.TextToggleButton class. It allows the look of the button to be expressed in CSS via the background-image style and displays a text label.  This view does not support right-to-left text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.CenterElement
classes.description: The CenterElement bead breaks the normal layout flow and forces a particlular element to stay centered.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.CheckBoxView
classes.description: The CheckBoxView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.CheckBox class. It displays a simple checkbox with an 'x' if checked, and a label on the right.  There are no styles or properties to configure the look of the 'x' or the position of the label relative to the checkbox as there are no equivalents in the standard HTML checkbox.  A more complex CheckBox could implement more view configuration.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.CloseButtonView
classes.description: The CloseButtonView class is the view for the down arrow button in a ScrollBar and other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ComboBoxView
classes.description: The ComboBoxView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.ComboBox component. The job of the view bead is to put together the parts of the ComboBox such as the TextInput control and org.apache.royale.html.Button to trigger the pop-up.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ContainerView
classes.description: This class creates and manages the contents of a Container. On the ActionScript side, a Container has a contentView into which the offical children can be placed. When adding an element that implements IChrome, that element is not placed into the contentView, but is made a child of the Container directly.  Containers also have a layout associated with them which controls the size and placement of the elements in the contentView. When a Container does not have an explicit size (including a percent size), the content dictates the size of the Container.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ControlBarMeasurementBead
classes.description: The ControlBarMeasurementBead class measures the size of a org.apache.royale.html.ControlBar component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataFieldProviderBead
classes.description: The DataFieldProviderBead class is a model that holds dataField used mostly in item renderers for retrieve some value from dataProvider items.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridColumnChangePropagator
classes.description: The DataGridColumnChangePropagator picks up the dataProviderChanged event and lets the data grid columns know about it.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridColumnForceChangePropagator
classes.description: The DataGridColumnForceChangePropagator picks up the dataProviderChanged event and lets the data grid columns know about it, whether or not the data provider object was changed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridColumnReorderView
classes.description: The DataGridColumnReorderView bead extends DataGridView and lists for changes to the model that is used to produce the column header. When this model changes, this view bead also changes the sub-components to match.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridColumnView
classes.description: The DataGridColumnView class extends org.apache.royale.html.beads.ListView and provides properties to the org.apache.royale.html.List that makes a column in the org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridDragDropBead
classes.description: The DataGridDragDropBead bead should be added to the DataGrid when drag and drop operations are required. Rather than using the drag and drop beads individually, this bead will add them as needed and monitor events to insure the drag and drop operations are handled property for the DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridDrawingLayerBead
classes.description: DataGridDrawingLayerBead places a graphic space into the DataGrid that is positioned above the Container used to hold the columns. This graphic space can be used to insert visualizations into the DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridLinesBead
classes.description: The DataGridLinesBead is an add on bead for the DataGrid. This bead adds horizontal and vertical grid lines to a DataGrid. The size and color of the lines is specified by the stroke property (defaults to a thin dark line).

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridPercentageView
classes.description: The DataGridPercentageView class is the visual bead for the org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid. This class constructs the items that make the DataGrid: Lists for each column and a org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar for the column headers. This class interprets the columnWidth value of each column to be a percentage rather than a pixel value.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridView
classes.description: The DataGridView class is the visual bead for the org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid. This class constructs the items that make the DataGrid: Lists for each column and a org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar for the column headers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataGridWithDrawingLayerLayout
classes.description: DataGridWithDrawingLayerLayout is a class that extends VerticalFlexLayout and positions the drawing layer created by a DataGridDrawingLayerBead.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataItemRendererFactoryForArrayData
classes.description: The DataItemRendererFactoryForArrayData class reads an array of data and creates an item renderer for every item in the array.  Other implementations of IDataProviderItemRendererMapper map different data structures or manage a virtual set of renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataItemRendererFactoryForArrayList
classes.description: The DataItemRendererFactoryForArrayList class uses an ArrayList and creates an item renderer for every item in the collection.  Other implementations of IDataProviderItemRendererMapper map different data structures or manage a virtual set of renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataItemRendererFactoryForCollectionView
classes.description: This class creates itemRenderer instances from the data contained within an ICollectionView

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataItemRendererFactoryForColumnData
classes.description: The DataItemRendererFactoryForColumnData class implents the org.apache.royale.core.IDataProviderItemRendererMapper interface and creates the itemRenderers for each cell in the org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataItemRendererFactoryForHierarchicalData
classes.description: The DataItemRendererFactoryForHierarchicalData class reads a HierarchicalData object and creates an item renderer for every item in the array.  Other implementations of IDataProviderItemRendererMapper map different data structures or manage a virtual set of renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataProviderChangeNotifier
classes.description: The DataProviderChangeNotifier notifies listeners when a selection model's ArrayList dataProvider has changed.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataProviderCollectionChangeNotifier
classes.description: The DataProviderCollectionChangeNotifier notifies listeners when a selection model's ArrayList dataProvider disptached collectionChanged event.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataProviderItemsChangeNotifier
classes.description: The DataProviderItemsChangeNotifier notifies listeners when to selection model's ArrayList dataProvider item has been added, removed or updated.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DateChooserView
classes.description: The DateChooserView class is a view bead for the DateChooser. This class creates the elements for the DateChooser: the buttons to move between months, the labels for the days of the week, and the buttons for each day of the month.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DateFieldView
classes.description: The DateFieldView class is a bead for DateField that creates the input and button controls. This class also handles the pop-up mechanics.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DisableBead
classes.description: The DisableBead class is a specialty bead that can be used with any UIBase. When disabled is true, the bead prevents interaction with the component. The appearance of the component when disabled is controlled by a separate bead.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DisableChildrenBead
classes.description: The DisableChildrenBead class is a specialty bead that can be used with any UIBase. When disabled is true, the bead prevents interaction with the component and its children. The appearance of the component when disabled is controlled by a separate bead.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DisabledAlphaBead
classes.description: The DisabledAlphaBead class is a specialty bead that can be used with any UIBase control which has a DisableBead attached. The bead takes properties for enabledAplha and disabledAlpha.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DispatchInputFinishedBead
classes.description: The DispatchInputFinishedBead class dispatched INPUT_FINISHED on strand when enter is pressed, or when foucus is out.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DispatchKeyboardEventBead
classes.description: The DispatchKeyboardEventBead class dispatches a KeyboardEvent from a text input.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DividedContainerView
classes.description: The DividedContainerView class is responsible for generating the DividedContainerSeparators between the children and placing them in the z-order between the children.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DownArrowButtonView
classes.description: The DownArrowButtonView class is the view for the down arrow button in a ScrollBar and other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DropDownListView
classes.description: The DropDownListView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.DropDownList class. It displays a simple text label with what appears to be a down arrow button on the right, but really, the entire view is the button that will display or dismiss the dropdown.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DynamicAddItemRendererForArrayListData
classes.description: Handles the adding of an itemRenderer once the corresponding datum has been added from the IDataProviderModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DynamicItemsRendererFactoryForArrayListData
classes.description: The DynamicItemsRendererFactoryForArrayListData class reads an array of data and creates an item renderer for every ISelectableItemRenderer in the array.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DynamicRemoveAllByNullItemRendererForArrayListData
classes.description: Handles the removal of all itemRenderers once data source is being set to null.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DynamicRemoveAllItemRendererForArrayListData
classes.description: Handles the removal of all itemRenderers once the all items has been removed from the IDataProviderModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DynamicRemoveItemRendererForArrayListData
classes.description: Handles the removal of an itemRenderer once the corresponding datum has been removed from the IDataProviderModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.DynamicUpdateItemRendererForArrayListData
classes.description: Handles the update of an itemRenderer once the corresponding datum has been updated from the IDataProviderModel.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.EasyDataProviderChangeNotifier
classes.description: The EasyDataProviderChangeNotifier is similar to DataProviderChangeNotifier but allows the user to populate the data provider after it's been added. Also, no attributes are required. Just add <EasyDataProviderChangeNotifier/>. The dataProvider is assumed to be an ArrayList.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.FormatableLabelView
classes.description: The FormatableLabelView class is a View bead that is capable of working with a format bead to display a formatted value. When the format bead has created a formatted string, it dispatches a formatChanged event that the FormatableLabelView class intercepts and displays in the label.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.FormatableTextInputView
classes.description: The FormatableTextInputView class is a View bead that extends TextInputWithBorderView and is capable of working with a format bead. When a format bead dispatches a formatChanged event, the FormatableTextInputView bead copies the formatted string to to the text field.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.GetScrollbarWidth
classes.description: The GetScrollbarWidth class detects the browser's default scrollbar width. This can be useful when changing the viewport width to avoid it being obstructed by the scrollbar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.GroupView
classes.description: The GroupView is a bead that manages the layout bead (if any) attached to a Group. This class also provides support for background and border styles for a Group on the SWF platform.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.HRuleView
classes.description: The ImageView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Image component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.HScrollBarThumbView
classes.description: The HScrollBarThumbView class is the view for the thumb button in a Horizontal ScrollBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.HScrollBarTrackView
classes.description: The HScrollBarTrackView class is the view for the track in a Horizontal ScrollBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.HScrollBarView
classes.description: The HScrollBarView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.HScrollBar class. It implements the classic desktop-like HScrollBar. A different view would implement more modern scrollbars that hide themselves until hovered over with the mouse.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IBackgroundBead
classes.description: The IBackgroundBead interface is a marker interface for beads that draw backgrounds.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IBorderBead
classes.description: The IBackgroundBead interface is a marker interface for beads that draw backgrounds.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IComboBoxView
classes.description: The IComboBoxView interface provides the protocol for any bead that creates the visual parts for a org.apache.royale.html.ComboBox control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IDataGridView
classes.description: The IDataGridView interface marks as a component as being the bead that can create the visual pieces for a org.apache.royale.html.DataGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IDrawingLayerBead
classes.description: The IDrawingLayerBead interface is implemented by beads that providing a a drawing surface within a component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IDropDownListView
classes.description: The IDropDownListView interface is the interface for views for the org.apache.royale.html.DropDownList.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IGraphicsDrawing
classes.description: The IGraphicsDrawing interface is a marker interface for beads that draw into the graphics layer.  This helps a bead determine if it is the first of many graphics drawing beads so it can know whether or not to clear the graphics layer before drawing.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IListView
classes.description: The IListView interface provides the protocol for any bead that creates the visual parts for a org.apache.royale.html.List control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.IScrollBarView
classes.description: The IScrollBarView interface is the interface for views for the org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ScrollBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ISliderView
classes.description: The ISliderView interface provides the protocol for any bead that creates the visual parts for a org.apache.royale.html.Slider control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ISpinnerView
classes.description: The ISpinnerView interface provides the protocol for any bead that creates the visual parts for a org.apache.royale.html.Spinner control.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ITextFieldView
classes.description: The ITextFieldView interface is the interface for views for the use a CSSTextField to display text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ITextItemRenderer
classes.description: The ITextItemRenderer interface is the interface for for org.apache.royale.core.IItemRenderer that display text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ImageAndTextButtonView
classes.description: The ImageButtonView class provides an image-only view for the standard Button. Unlike the CSSButtonView, this class does not support background and border; only images for the up, over, and active states.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ImageButtonView
classes.description: The ImageButtonView class provides an image-only view for the standard Button. Unlike the CSSButtonView, this class does not support background and border; only images for the up, over, and active states.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ImageView
classes.description: The ImageView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Image component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.InnerHTML
classes.description: The InnerText bead class adds innetHTML text to a html tag.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.LeftArrowButtonView
classes.description: The LeftArrowButtonView class is the view for the left arrow button in a ScrollBar and other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ListDrawingLayerBead
classes.description: ListDrawingLayerBead places a graphic space into the List that is positioned the item renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.MenuView
classes.description: Supplies the view for a menu.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.MultilineTextFieldView
classes.description: The TextFieldView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.Label class. It displays text using a TextField, so there is no right-to-left text support in this view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.NumericStepperView
classes.description: The NumericStepperView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.NumericStepper component. A NumberStepper consists of a org.apache.royale.html.TextInput component to display the value and a org.apache.royale.html.Spinner to change the value.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.PanelView
classes.description: The Panel class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Panel component. A Panel has a org.apache.royale.html.TitleBar, and content.  A different View, PanelWithControlBarView, can display a ControlBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.PanelWithControlBarView
classes.description: The Panel class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Panel component. A Panel has a org.apache.royale.html.TitleBar, content, and an optional org.apache.royale.html.ControlBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.RadioButtonView
classes.description: The RadioButtonView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.RadioButton component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.RangeStepperView
classes.description: The RangeStepperView bead creates the visual elements of the RangeStepper. This includes an increment button, a decrement button, and label to display the value.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.RightArrowButtonView
classes.description: The RightArrowButtonView class is the view for the right arrow button in a ScrollBar and other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ScrollBarView
classes.description: The ScrollBarView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ScrollBar class. It implements the classic desktop-like ScrollBar. A different view would implement more modern scrollbars that hide themselves until hovered over with the mouse.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SimpleAlertView
classes.description: The SimpleAlertView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.SimpleAlert component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SingleLineBorderBead
classes.description: The SingleLineBorderBead class draws a single line solid border. The color and thickness can be specified in CSS.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SingleLineBorderWithChangeListenerBead
classes.description: The SingleLineBorderWithChangeListenerBead adds the ability to react to changes in border style at runtime.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SingleSelectionContainerBead
classes.description: Use SingleSelectionContainerBead is a bead which manages selection state of a component which contains a group of ISelectables. One such example would be a toggle button bar.  Only one of the elements can be selected at any one time.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SingleSelectionDragImageBead
classes.description: The SingleSelectionDragImageBead produces a UIBase component that represents the item being dragged. It does this by taking the data associcated with the index of the item selected and running the toString() function on it, placing it inside of a Label that is inside of Group (which is given the className of "DragImage").  The createDragImage() function can be overridden and a different component returned.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SingleSelectionDragSourceBead
classes.description: The SingleSelectionDragSourceBead brings drag capability to single-selection List components. By adding this bead, a user can drag a row of the List to a new location within the list. This bead should be used in conjunction with SingleSelectionDropTargetBead.  This bead adds a new event to the strand, "dragImageNeeded", which is dispatched on the strand just prior to the dragImage's appearance. An event listener can create its own dragImage if the default, taken from the data item, is not suitable.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SingleSelectionDropIndicatorBead
classes.description: The SingleSelectionDropIndicatorBead provides a graphic used to help the user place the item being dropped.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SingleSelectionDropTargetBead
classes.description: The SingleSelectionDropTargetBead enables items to be dropped onto single-selection List components. This bead can be used with SingleSelectionDragSourceBead to enable the re-arrangement of rows within the same list.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SliderThumbView
classes.description: The SliderThumbView class creates the draggable input element for the org.apache.royale.html.Slider component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SliderTrackView
classes.description: The SliderTrackView class creates the track area for the org.apache.royale.html.Slider component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SliderView
classes.description: The SliderView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Slider component. The Slider has a track and a thumb control which are also created with view beads.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SolidBackgroundBead
classes.description: The SolidBackgroundBead class draws a solid filled background. The color and opacity can be specified in CSS.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SolidBackgroundWithChangeListenerBead
classes.description: Same as SolidBackgroundBead except it listens for StyleChangeEvent events and reacts by refreshing the background of its strand.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.SpinnerView
classes.description: The SpinnerView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Spinner component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TableCellView
classes.description: The TableCellView class is the view bead for TableCell. It has no function on the JS platform, but with SWF, it prevents the cell from shrinking to fit its content.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextAreaView
classes.description: The TextAreaView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.TextArea class. It implements the classic desktop-like TextArea with a border and scrollbars.  It does not support right-to-left text.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextButtonMeasurementBead
classes.description: The TextButtonMeasurementBead class helps measure a org.apache.royale.html.TextButton.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextButtonView
classes.description: The TextButtonView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.TextButton class.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextFieldLabelMeasurementBead
classes.description: The TextFieldLabelMeasurementBead class helps to measure org.apache.royale.html.Label components.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextFieldView
classes.description: The TextFieldView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.Label class. It displays text using a TextField, so there is no right-to-left text support in this view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextFieldViewBase
classes.description: The TextFieldViewBase class is the base class for the components that display text. It displays text using a TextField, so there is no right-to-left text support in this view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextInputView
classes.description: The TextInputView class is the view for the org.apache.royale.html.TextInput in a ComboBox and other controls because it does not display a border. It displays text using a TextField, so there is no right-to-left text support in this view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextInputWithBorderView
classes.description: The TextInputWithBorderView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.TextInput. It displays text using a TextField, so there is no right-to-left text support in this view.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextItemRendererFactoryForArrayData
classes.description: The TextItemRendererFactoryForArrayData class is the IDataProviderItemRendererMapper for creating ITextItemRenderers and assigning them data from an array. Other IDataProviderItemRendererMapper implementations assign specific array or vector types to item renderers expecting those types.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextItemRendererFactoryForStringVectorData
classes.description: The TextItemRendererFactoryForStringVectorData class is the IDataProviderItemRendererMapper for creating ITextItemRenderers and assigning them data from an vector of Strings.  Other IDataProviderItemRendererMapper implementations assign specific array or vector types to item renderers expecting those types.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TextOverflow
classes.description: The TextOverflow class is a bead that can be used with a TextButton control to stop the text from overflowing.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.ThrottleBead
classes.description: The ThrottleBead class allows you to listen to an event only after a timeout has been reached. This can be useful in situations where events are thrown repeatedly but the application is only interested in the last dispatching.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TitleBarMeasurementBead
classes.description: The TitleBarMeasurementBead class measures the overall size of a org.apache.royale.html.TitleBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.TreeGridView
classes.description: The TreeGridView class is responsible for creating the sub-components of the TreeGrid: the ButtonBar header, the Tree (first column), and Lists (rest of the columns), as well as the container that holds the columns. This bead will also add in a TreeGridLayout if one has not already been created or specified in CSS.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.UnselectableElementBead
classes.description: UnselectableElement bead prevents from text selection of html element

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.UpArrowButtonView
classes.description: The UpArrowButtonView class is the view for the up arrow button in a ScrollBar and other controls.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.VRuleView
classes.description: The ImageView class creates the visual elements of the org.apache.royale.html.Image component.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.VScrollBarThumbView
classes.description: The VScrollBarThumbView class is the view for the thumb button in a Vertical ScrollBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.VScrollBarTrackView
classes.description: The VScrollBarTrackView class is the view for the track in a Vertical ScrollBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.VScrollBarView
classes.description: The ScrollBarView class is the default view for the org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.VScrollBar class. It implements the classic desktop-like VScrollBar. A different view would implement more modern scrollbars that hide themselves until hovered over with the mouse.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.VirtualDataItemRendererFactoryForArrayData
classes.description: The DataItemRendererFactoryForArrayData class reads an array of data and creates an item renderer for every item in the array.  Other implementations of IDataProviderItemRendererMapper map different data structures or manage a virtual set of renderers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.WebBrowserView
classes.description: The WebBrowserView creates an instance of HTMLLoader to load web pages into AIR application.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.AlertController
classes.description: The AlertControler class bead handles the close event on the org.apache.royale.html.Alert by removing the org.apache.royale.html.Alert from the display.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.ButtonAutoRepeatController
classes.description: The ButtonAutoRepeatController class adds autorepeat functionality to a button.  This version is simply waits a specified amount of time (default is 250ms), then repeats the button event at a specified interval, which defaults to 125 milliseconds.  Alternate implementations could have non-linear repeat timing, look for keyboard modifiers to choose different rates, etc.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.DateChooserMouseController
classes.description: The DateChooserMouseController class is responsible for listening to mouse event related to the DateChooser. Events such as selecting a date or changing the calendar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.DateFieldMouseController
classes.description: The DateFieldMouseController class is responsible for monitoring the mouse events on the elements of the DateField. A click on the DateField's menu button triggers the pop-up, for example.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.DragMouseController
classes.description: The DragMouseController bead handles mouse events on the a component, looking for activity that constitutes the start of a drag drop operation.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.DropDownListController
classes.description: The DropDownListController class is the controller for org.apache.royale.html.DropDownList.  Controllers watch for events from the interactive portions of a View and update the data model or dispatch a semantic event. This controller watches for the click event and displays the dropdown/popup, and watches the dropdown/popup for change events and updates the selection model accordingly.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.DropMouseController
classes.description: The DropMouseController bead handles mouse events on the a component, looking for events from a drag/drop operation.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.EditableTextKeyboardController
classes.description: The EditableTextKeyboardController class bead intercepts keyboard events on the component's text field and emits change events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.HDividedContainerMouseController
classes.description: This is the mouse controller for the HDividedContainer. This bead class tracks the mouse over a HDividedContainerDivider (its strand) causing the columns on either side of the divider to grow and shrink.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.HScrollBarMouseController
classes.description: The HScrollBarMouseController class is the controller for org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.HScrollBar that acts as the Horizontal ScrollBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.HSliderMouseController
classes.description: The HSliderMouseController class bead handles mouse events on the org.apache.royale.html.Slider's component parts (thumb and track) and dispatches change events on behalf of the Slider (as well as co-ordinating visual changes (such as moving the thumb when the track has been tapped or clicked). Use this controller for horizontally oriented Sliders.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.ItemRendererMouseController
classes.description: The ItemRendererMouseController class can mouse events in itemRenderers. This includes roll-overs, mouse down, and mouse up. These platform-specific events are then re-dispatched as Royale events.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.ListSingleSelectionMouseController
classes.description: The ListSingleSelectionMouseController class is a controller for org.apache.royale.html.List.  Controllers watch for events from the interactive portions of a View and update the data model or dispatch a semantic event. This controller watches for events from the item renderers and updates an ISelectionModel (which only supports single selection).  Other controller/model pairs would support various kinds of multiple selection.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.MenuSelectionMouseController
classes.description: Listens for item selections on the component and translates them to external events. Also listens for events on the background and uses them to dismiss the menu.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.RangeStepperMouseController
classes.description: The RangeStepperMouseController bead feeds mouse events to the RangeStepper and its components.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.ScrollBarMouseControllerBase
classes.description: The ScrollBarMouseControllerBase class is the base class for ScrollBarMouseControllers such as VScrollBarMouseController.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.SpinnerMouseController
classes.description: The SpinnerMouseController class bead handles mouse events on the org.apache.royale.html.Spinner's component buttons, changing the value of the Spinner.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.TreeSingleSelectionMouseController
classes.description: The TreeSingleSelectionMouseController class is a controller for org.apache.royale.html.Tree. This controller watches for selection events on the tree item renderers and uses those events to open or close nodes of the tree.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.VDividedContainerMouseController
classes.description: This is the mouse controller for the VDividedContainer. This bead class tracks the mouse over a VDividedContainerDivider (its strand) causing the rows above and below it to grow and shrink.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.VScrollBarMouseController
classes.description: The VScrollBarMouseController class is the controller for org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ScrollBar that acts as the Vertical ScrollBar.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.controllers.VSliderMouseController
classes.description: The VSliderMouseController class bead handles mouse events on the org.apache.royale.html.Slider's component parts (thumb and track) and dispatches change events on behalf of the Slider (as well as co-ordinating visual changes (such as moving the thumb when the track has been tapped or clicked). Use this controller for vertically oriented Sliders.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.BasicLayout
classes.description: The BasicLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out as specified by CSS properties like left, right, top and bottom.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.ButtonBarLayout
classes.description: The ButtonBarLayout class bead sizes and positions the button elements that make up a org.apache.royale.html.ButtonBar. This bead arranges the Buttons horizontally and makes them all the same width unless the buttonWidths property has been set in which case the values stored in that array are used.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.DataGridLayout
classes.description: DataGridLayout is a class that handles the size and positioning of the elements of a DataGrid. This includes the ButtonBar used for the column headers and the Lists that are the columns.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.DataGridPercentageLayout
classes.description: DataGridPercentageLayout is a class that handles the size and positioning of the elements of a DataGrid. This includes the ButtonBar used for the column headers and the Lists that are the columns. The columns are sized on their percentage of the width of the DataGrid space.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.FlexibleFirstChildHorizontalLayout
classes.description: The FlexibleFirstChildHorizontalLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out horizontally in one row, separating them according to CSS layout rules for margin and padding styles. But it will size the first child to take up as much or little room as possible.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.HDividedContainerLayout
classes.description: This sub-class of DividedContainerLayout class is responsible for sizing and positioning the children of the DividedContainer into columns with separators between them.  In order to correctly size and place the children, the DividedContainerLayout relies on additional information contained in the DividedContainerModel. These adjustments (which default to zero) can be changed by interacting with the DividedContainerSeparators and their mouse controllers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.HScrollBarLayout
classes.description: The HScrollBarLayout class is a layout bead that displays lays out the pieces of a horizontal ScrollBar like the thumb, track and arrow buttons.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.HorizontalFlowLayout
classes.description: The HorizontalFlowLayout class bead sizes and positions the elements it manages into rows and columns. It does this by seeing how many elements will fit horizontally and then flow the remainder onto the next lines. If an element does not already have an explicit or percentage size, a size is chosen for it based on the defaultColumnCount property which divides the layout space into equal number of cells as a default measurement.  The height of each row is determined by the tallest element in the row. The next row flows below that.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.HorizontalLayout
classes.description: The HorizontalLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out horizontally in one row, separating them according to CSS layout rules for margin and vertical-align styles.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.HorizontalLayoutWithPaddingAndGap
classes.description: The HorizontalLayoutWithPaddingAndGap class is a simple layout bead similar to HorizontalLayout, but it adds support for padding and gap values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.HorizontalSliderLayout
classes.description: Use the HorizontalSliderLayout with a Slider to orient the Slider horizontally.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.IDataGridLayout
classes.description: DataGridLayout is a class that handles the size and positioning of the elements of a DataGrid. This includes the ButtonBar used for the column headers and the Lists that are the columns.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.IOneFlexibleChildLayout
classes.description: IOneFlexibleChildLayout will flex one of the children to take up the space remaining in a container after the rest of the elements have been laid out according to CSS layout rules.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.LayoutChangeNotifier
classes.description: The LayoutChangeNotifier notifies layouts when a property it is watching changes.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.LayoutOnShow
classes.description: This bead ensures that IUIBase objects that are displayed are also laid out. Basic components can do without this behavior if it is known that the layout does not change.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.OneFlexibleChildHorizontalLayout
classes.description: The OneFlexibleChildHorizontalLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out horizontally in one row, separating them according to CSS layout rules for margin and padding styles. But it will size the one child to take up as much or little room as possible.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.OneFlexibleChildHorizontalLayoutForOverflow
classes.description: The OneFlexibleChildHorizontalLayoutForOverflowis intended for building apps that clip and/or scroll the overflow, especially in a 3-pane view like the ASDoc examples.  It does not use FlexBox because FlexBox wants to grow to the size of the content without specifying width/height on the flexible child.  But then the children in the flexible child cannot use % sizing. This layout presumes the parent is a known size.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.OneFlexibleChildVerticalLayout
classes.description: The OneFlexibleChildVerticalLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out vertically in one column, separating them according to CSS layout rules for margin and padding styles. But it will size the one child to take up as much or little room as possible.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.OneFlexibleChildVerticalLayoutForOverflow
classes.description: The OneFlexibleChildVerticalLayoutForOverflow is intended for building apps that clip and/or scroll the overflow, especially in a 3-pane view like the ASDoc examples.  It does not use FlexBox because FlexBox wants to grow to the size of the content without specifying width/height on the flexible child.  But then the children in the flexible child cannot use % sizing. This layout presumes the parent is a known size.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.RemovableBasicLayout
classes.description: The RemovableBasicLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out as specified by CSS properties like left, right, top and bottom. It correctly handles removal and replacement between different strands, and null strand assignment

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.SimpleTableLayout
classes.description: The SimpleTableLayout is the layout for the Table component. On the SWF platform it mimics the HTML <table> element and makes sure all the columns and rows are even. It does not support column or row spanning.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.TableCellLayout
classes.description: The TableCellLayout is the default layout for TableCell items. It places the cell's contents vertically centered within the cell.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.TableHeaderLayout
classes.description: The TableHeaderLayout is the default layout for TableHeader items. It places the cell's contents vertically and horizontally centered within the cell.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.TileLayout
classes.description: The TileLayout class bead sizes and positions the elements it manages into rows and columns. The size of each element is determined either by setting TileLayout's columnWidth and rowHeight properties, or having the tile size determined by factoring the numColumns into the area assigned for the layout.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.TreeGridLayout
classes.description: The TreeGridLayout class provides the sizing and positioning for the sub-components that make up the TreeGrid.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.VDividedContainerLayout
classes.description: This sub-class of DividedContainerLayout class is responsible for sizing and positioning the children of the DividedContainer into rows with separators between them.  In order to correctly size and place the children, the DividedContainerLayout relies on additional information contained in the DividedContainerModel. These adjustments (which default to zero) can be changed by interacting with the DividedContainerSeparators and their mouse controllers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.VScrollBarLayout
classes.description: The VScrollBarLayout class is a layout bead that displays lays out the pieces of a vertical ScrollBar like the thumb, track and arrow buttons.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.VerticalColumnLayout
classes.description: ColumnLayout is a class that organizes the positioning of children of a container into a set of columns where each column's width is set to the maximum size of all of the children in that column.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.VerticalLayout
classes.description: The VerticalLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out vertically in one column, separating them according to CSS layout rules for margin and horizontal-align styles.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.VerticalLayoutWithPaddingAndGap
classes.description: The VerticalLayoutWithPaddingAndGap class is a simple layout bead similar to VerticalLayout, but it adds support for padding and gap values.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.VerticalSliderLayout
classes.description: Use the VerticalSliderLayout with a Slider to orient the slider vertically.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.layouts.VirtualListVerticalLayout
classes.description: The VerticalLayout class is a simple layout bead.  It takes the set of children and lays them out vertically in one column, separating them according to CSS layout rules for margin and horizontal-align styles.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.AlertModel
classes.description: The AlertModel class bead implements the org.apache.royale.core.IAlertModel and holds the properties for an org.apache.royale.html.Alert such the buttons to use and message to display.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ArrayListSelectionModel

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ArraySelectionModel
classes.description: The ArraySelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an array. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider dataProvider[index].  Other selection models would support other kinds of data providers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.BinaryImageModel

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ButtonBarModel
classes.description: The ArraySelectionModel class is a selection model for a dataProvider that is an array. It assumes that items can be fetched from the dataProvider dataProvider[index].  Other selection models would support other kinds of data providers.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ComboBoxModel

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DataGridCollectionViewModel

Use this with org.apache.royale.html.beads.DataItemRenderFactoryForCollectionView for each DataGridColumn.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DataGridPresentationModel

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.DataProviderModel

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.ListPresentationModel
classes.description: The ListPresentationModel holds values used by list controls for presenting their user interfaces.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.beads.models.MenuModel

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DataGridColumnList

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.DataGroup

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.MenuItemRenderer

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.NestedStringItemRenderer

For example, if the data is an Object having: {title: "Something", address:{street: "Main", zip: "02118"}} using NestedStringItemRenderer for the address field can extract any of its consitutents: labelField="address.zip".

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.OverflowViewport

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.PanelLayoutProxy

If Panel were being used, its numElements, getElementAt, etc. functions would actually redirect to its Container content. In order for a layout to work on the Panel directly (its TitleBar, Container, and ControlBar children), this proxy is used which will invoke the Panel's $numElements, $getElementAt, etc functions.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.RadioButtonIcon

RadioButton use the following beads:  org.apache.royale.core.IBeadModel: the data model, which includes the groupName. org.apache.royale.core.IBeadView:  the bead that constructs the visual parts of the RadioButton..

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.ScrollBar

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.StringItemRenderer

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TextButtonItemRenderer

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TextFieldItemRenderer

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TreeGridColumn

classes.name: org.apache.royale.html.supportClasses.TreeListData

classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.URLBinaryUploader
classes.description: The URLBinaryUploader class subclasses URLBinaryLoader to offer upload progress events.  This class is only used for JS implementations because Flash upload events need to be handled differently. In Flash, URLLoader does not dispatch upload events. It only dispatches download events. To get upload events in Flash, you need to use File/FileReference.upload() and attach event listeners to that.  Care should be taken when using this class because it attaches a progress listener to the xhr.upload object. Doing so causes browsers to send OPTIONS requests. This will return an unauthorized response from servers not configured to allow CORS OPTIONS requests. See this S.O. post for details. https://stackoverflow.com/a/17057853

This class is only used for JS implementations because Flash upload events need to be handled differently. In Flash, URLLoader does not dispatch upload events. It only dispatches download events. To get upload events in Flash, you need to use File/FileReference.upload() and attach event listeners to that.  Care should be taken when using this class because it attaches a progress listener to the xhr.upload object. Doing so causes browsers to send OPTIONS requests. classes.name: org.apache.royale.net.remoting.messages.AbstractMessage

Abstract base class for all messages. Messages have two customizable sections; headers and body. The headers property provides access to specialized meta information for a specific message instance. The headers property is an associative array with the specific header name as the key.

The body of a message contains the instance specific data that needs to be delivered and processed by the remote destination. The body is an object and is the payload for a message.

The UIDUtil class is an all-static class with methods for working with UIDs (unique identifiers) within Royale. You do not create instances of UIDUtil; instead you simply call static methods such as the UIDUtil.createUID() method.

Note: If you have a dynamic object that has no [Bindable] properties (which force the object to implement the IUID interface), Royale adds an internal property that contains a UID to the object. IUndoManager defines the interface for managing the undo and redo stacks.

An undo manager maintains a stack of operations that can be undone and redone.

classes.name: org.apache.royale.utils.undo.UndoManager
classes.description:
The UndoManager class manages the history of editing operations on a text flow so that these operations can be undone and redone.

The undo manager maintains two stacks of IOperation objects. When a reversible operation is executed, it is placed on the undo stack. If that operation is undone, it is removed from the undo stack, reversed, and placed on the redo stack. Likewise, if that operation is then redone, it is removed from the redo stack, re-executed, and then placed onto the undo stack again. If another operation is executed first, the redo stack is cleared.

If the TextFlow is modified directly (not via calls to the edit manager, but directly via calls to the managed FlowElement objects), then the edit manager clears the undo stack to prevent the stack from getting out of sync with the current state.
